title: Ticket #7192: better submit_utils Requirements generation for custom resources
description:
Requirements generation for submit_utils will be changed, in part because of #6936 (request for 0 of a custom resource should not alter Requirements), since the fix for this bug does not apply to the 8.9 submit_utils code.

In 8.9, requirements generation will refer to job attributes rather than to submit keywords. This means that MY.RequestGPUs affect the generated requirements in the same way that request_gpus does.

The fix for #6936 will be refined. custom resource requests will affect requirements generation by

  • If the resource request is an expression that evaluates to a number at submit time, and the number is > 0, then requirements will be altered.
  • If the resource request is an expression that evaluates to undefined at submit time, requirements will be altered as if it were a number > 0
  • If the resource request is an expression that evaluates to a string, requirements will be altered if the string is non-empty

Always, requirements will not be altered if they already refer to the custom resource. i.e. if the requirements already refers to GPUs, then RequestGPUs will not result a change to the requirements.

Furthermore, if the submit hash has MY.Requirements or "+Requirements", requirements generation will be entirely disabled. This will also disable the side effects of requirements generation, since these side effects exist to insure that attributes referred to by generated requirements will exist.

  • Crondor jobs will not have a ScheddInterval attribute inserted into the job.
  • VM universe jobs that use VMWare transfer will not have a FileSystemDomain attribute inserted.
